result.execSummary:
The defendant Justin Robert White was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Armed Robbery with Threat of Force, a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.32(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Hearing 7/21/2014.
*8-18-14 Judge Moroney, Court ordered defendant to pay restitution to Wisconsin Vision in the amount of $1765.88 from prison funds not to exceed 25%. Balance to be paid while on extended supervision. Failure to pay would result in a civil judgment entered against defendant which is non-dischargable in bankruptcy *
*2/1/2017  amended to $1,015.33.  Further amended to reflect a single order for payment of restitution, costs and surcharges including  DNA surcharge; at the rate of 25% of prison funds. To be paid in accordance with Section 973.20(12)(b) Stats.  This order shall supercede all prior orders addressing the payment of financial obligations in this case.

Provide DNA sample if not previously taken.  Pay DNA surcharge, costs, surcharges and restitution from prison funds not to exceed 25%.  Balance to be paid while on Extended supervision.  Failure to pay would result in a civil judgment entered against defendant which is nondischargable in bankruptcy.
Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other sentence.

superMiscConds.notes: Seek and maintain employment.  Be given job and vocational training.

No controlled substances or alcohol.
No contact with Kristy S., Lao X. or Wisconsin Vision.
Parenting, anger management and cognitive thinking intervention counseling.
AODA assessment and treatment.  Urine screens.

supervisions.notes: Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon not to possess any firearms or body armor; further  advised defendant of voting ineligibility

charges.descr: Armed Robbery with Threat of Force

IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that the deadline under Wis. Stat. Rule 809.30(2)(b) (2015-16), for White to file a notice of intent to pursue postconviction relief from the amended judgment of February 3, 2017, is extended through September 11, 20176.  See Wis. per order dated June 16, 2017, Appeal No. 2017AP852-CR, IT IS ORDERED that the appellant shall file a memorandum by June 30, 2017.  The respondent shall file a response within seven days of receipt of appellant's memorandum.  The memoranda shall not exceeed five pages in length.  IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that the filing of the appellant's brief is stayed;  if this court confirms jurisdiction, the appellant's brief is due forty days from the order confirming jurisdiction.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Justin Robert White in court with attorney Anne M. Jaspers.  Defendant Justin Robert White in custody.  Joanne L. Hardtke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Entry made without file.  Restitution hearing proceeds.  Sworn for the State:  Mr. Darren H.  Arguments by the State and defense counsel. The Court ordered defendant to pay restitution to Wisconsin Vision in the amount of $1,765.88 from prison funds not to exeed 25%.  Balance to be paid while on extended supervision.  Failure to pay would result in a civil judgment entered against defendant which is non-dischargable in bankrutpcy.

Filed,
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief.
Videotechnician notified that an OTP was received by the institution to produce defendant.  Therefore, the video hearing is cancelled, as defendant will appear in person.

Defendant Justin Robert White in court with attorney Anne M. Jaspers.  Defendant Justin Robert White in custody and appeared by video.  Joanne L. Hardtke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Restitution hearing proceeds; arguments heard.  Court ordered case adjourned to obtain additional information about restitution requested by second victim. Videotechnician cleared for that date.  Restitution hearing scheduled for August 18, 2014 at 08:30 am.
/from Wisconsin Vision dated 06/12/14, filed.
Video conference set on today's date.
/and Restitution Worksheet, received and filed. rn

Attorney Anne M Jaspers in court, defendant Justin Robert White not in court, in custody.  Timothy J Cotter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 2.  Stipulated request for adjournment received and filed.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 25, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Certification of transcript of proceedings of PRELIMINARY HEARING commencing APRIL 9, 2014 received and filed. (12 Pages.)
Copy of transcript forwarded to  Anne Jaspers - SPD  819 N 6th Street  9th Floor  Milwaukee, WI  53203.

Attorney Anne M Jaspers in court, defendant Justin Robert White not in court, in custody.  Joanne L Hardtke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Defense needs time to review State's offer with the defendant.
Defense requests a status conference date.
  Stipulated request for adjournment received and filed.
Case adjourned to 05-16-2014 at 8:30 AM - Br. 2, Judge Donald's Court for Status Conference.

Defendant Justin Robert White in court with Mindy Nolan, student intern under the supervision of attorney Anne M. Jaspers.  Defendant Justin Robert White in custody.  Joanne L. Hardtke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state:Eric Sturino-West Allis Police Department Detective.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and pleads not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 18, 2014 at 08:30 am.
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Wisconsin Vision Center located at 1401 S. 108th St., West Allis, WI as well as Lao X. and Kristy S.

Defendant Justin Robert White in court with attorney Anne M. Jaspers.  Defendant Justin Robert White in custody.  Carole R. Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Donald, Branch 02.  
Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 9, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
